1.q_string:
Consider the reaction: 

\(2 \mathrm{C}+\mathrm{O}_2 \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{CO} ; \Delta \mathrm{H}=-220 k J\)

 Which of the following statements is/are correct for this reaction?
According to the diagram given below, the value of \(\Delta H\) (in \(\mathrm{KJ}\)) for conversion of \(A\) to \(B\) is:
Which of the following equation represents first enthalpy of ionization?

Calculate the standard enthalpy of formation of \(\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{OH}(\mathrm{I})\) from the following data

\(\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{OH}(\mathrm{I})+\frac{3}{2} \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{CO}_2(\mathrm{~g})+2 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{l}) ; \triangle_{\mathrm{r}} \mathrm{H}^\theta=-726 \mathrm{~kJmol}^{-1} \)

\(\mathrm{C}_{\text {(graphite) }}+\mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{CO}_2(\mathrm{~g}) ; \triangle_{\mathrm{c}} \mathrm{H}^\theta=-393 \mathrm{~kJmol}^{-1} \)

\(\mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{l}) ; \triangle_{\mathrm{f}} \mathrm{H}^\theta=-286 \mathrm{~kJmol}^{-1}\)
The amount of heat liberated when 1 mole of a substance is completely burnt in the presence of oxygen is known as:

The heat of combustion of benzene in a bomb calorimeter (i.e., constant volume) was found to be \(3263.9 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) at \(25^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). Calculate the heat of combustion of benzene at constant pressure.

Enthalpy of neutralisation of acetic acid by \(\mathrm{NaOH}\) is \(-50.6 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\). Calculate \(\Delta \mathrm{H}\) for ionisation of \(\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{COOH}\). Given, the heat of neutralisation of a strong acid with a strong base is \(-55.9 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\).
Bond energy of hydrogen gas is \(-433 \mathrm{~kJ}\). How much is the bond dissociation energy of 0.5 mole of hydrogen gas?

For the reaction, \(2 \mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g}) ; \Delta \mathrm{H}=-571 \mathrm{~kJ}\)

The bond energy of \((\mathrm{H}-\mathrm{H})=435 \mathrm{~kJ}\); of \((\mathrm{O}=\mathrm{O})=498 \mathrm{~kJ}\), then calculate the average bond energy of \((\mathrm{O}-\mathrm{H})\) bond using the above data.

q_option: The heat change in a chemical reaction.
Influence of pressure on volume of a gas.
1.q_string: Hess's Law deals with:
When a solid changes into liquid, the entropy:
In a reavrsible process, \(\Delta \mathrm{S}_{\text {system }}+\Delta \mathrm{S}_{\text {surrounding }}\) is:
Which of the following is the unit of entropy?
Dissolution of ammonium chloride in water is an endothermic reaction, yet it is a spontaneous process. This is due to the fact that:

Enthalpy change for the process, \(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\) ice \() \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\) (water) is \(6.01 \mathrm{~KJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\). The entropy change of 1 mole of ice at its melting point will be:
Which of the following relationship is incorrect?

The standard enthalpy and standard entropy changes for the oxidation of ammonia at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\) are \(382.64 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) and \(145.6 \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\), respectively. Standard Gibb's energy change for the same reaction at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\) is:

The enthalpy and entropy change for the reaction \(\mathrm{Br}_2(\mathrm{I})+\mathrm{Cl}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{BrCl}(\mathrm{g})\) are \(30 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) and \(105 \mathrm{~KJ}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) respectively. The temperature at which the reaction will be in equilibrium is:

q_option: Increases the boiling point of the liquid
Lowers the boiling point of the liquid
Does not affect the boiling point of the liquid
Increases the time required for it to boil
1.q_string: Lowering the atmospheric pressure on a liquid:

q_option: If \(\Delta \mathrm{G}_{\text {system }}=0\), the system is still moving in a particular direction.
If \(\Delta G_{\text {system }}<0\), the process is not spontaneous.
1.q_string: Identify the correct statement for change of Gibbs energy for a system \(\left(\Delta \mathrm{G}_{\text {system }}\right)\) at constant temperature and pressure.

q_option: The sum of the standard enthalpies of the intermediate reactions into which the overall reaction may be divided at the same temperature.
The difference of the standard enthalpies of the intermediate reactions into which the overall reaction may be divided at the same temperature.
The sum of the standard enthalpies of the intermediate reactions into which the overall reaction may be divided at 35°C.
The sum of the standard enthalpies of the intermediate reactions into which the overall reaction may be divided at 2 bar.
1.q_string: According to Hess’s Law, if a reaction takes place in several steps then its standard reaction enthalpy is:

q_option: One kg of bonds completely to obtain atoms in the gas phase.
One kg of bonds completely to obtain atoms in the liquid phase.
One mole of bonds completely to obtain atoms in the gas phase.
One mole of bonds completely to obtain atoms in the liquid phase.
1.q_string: Enthalpy of atomization is enthalpy change on breaking:

q_option: When one mole of it reacts with a specified amount of solvent.
When one mole of it dissolves in a specified amount of solvent.
When one kg of it reacts with a specified amount of solvent.
When one kg of it dissolves in a specified amount of solvent.
1.q_string: Enthalpy of solution of a substance is the enthalpy change:

q_option: One mole of an ionic compound dissociates into its ions in liquid state.
One gm of an ionic compound dissociates into its ions in gaseous state
One mole of an ionic compound dissociates into its ions in gaseous state.
One kg of an ionic compound dissociates into its ions in liquid state.
1.q_string: The lattice enthalpy of an ionic compound is the enthalpy change which occurs when:

q_option: Having the potential to proceed without the assistance of external agency.
Having the potential to proceed with the assistance of external agency.
1.q_string: Spontaneity in the context of chemical thermodynamics means:

q_option: The degree of regularity or order in the system.
The degree of randomness or disorder in the system.
